meanings.definition: Not resonating or vibrating in response to external stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The old, nonresonant bell remained silent even when struck.
meanings.sent2: The nonresonant guitar string produced a dull sound.
meanings.sent3: The nonresonant alarm clock decided to take a break and didn't ring in the morning.
meanings.sent4: Her nonresonant voice failed to capture the audience's attention.
meanings.sent5: The nonresonant drumbeat lacked energy and enthusiasm.

meanings.definition: Not producing a strong or lasting effect or impression.
meanings.sent1: The nonresonant speech left the audience uninterested.
meanings.sent2: His nonresonant apology did not mend the broken trust.
meanings.sent3: The nonresonant fireworks fizzled out quickly, disappointing the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The nonresonant movie plot failed to leave a mark on the viewers.
meanings.sent5: The nonresonant perfume scent faded away within minutes.

meanings.definition: Not in harmony or agreement with something.
meanings.sent1: Her nonresonant opinions clashed with the group's beliefs.
meanings.sent2: The nonresonant colors in the painting created a jarring effect.
meanings.sent3: The nonresonant puzzle pieces refused to fit together no matter how hard she tried.
meanings.sent4: Their nonresonant schedules made it difficult to find a suitable time to meet.
meanings.sent5: The nonresonant flavors in the dish seemed to fight against each other on the palate.
